comment: I am deeply impressed by Professor Glassmeyer's content knowledge and high academic standards.  He designs all of his course materials to respond directly to primary sources and does so in a sequence that helps to make sure that students understand the subject matter in depth and he responds to questions during virtual class and replies to email.
Fair and informational. Assignments are weekly, with weekly online classes. Participation in group breakout sessions is encouraged.
Dr. Glassmeyer was a joy to work with. He is prepared and offers engaging content with collaborative group break-out sessions and follow-up discussions. Highly recommend.

This professor is a GEM! I have taken him 2 courses in Undergrad. Now, three years later, I am taking him for a Graduate course. The thing that makes him most unique is he actually teaches his colleged students using the pedagogy and best practices that he is teaching teachers to use! He not only teaches content, but models it! AMAZING!

I would not recommend taking this class unless you already know everything about math. In-class assignments are all group work and he expects your group members to teach you. He'll answer questions, but it honestly never helped. He assigns homework for every class meeting, and he has 4 exams. The final exam is a take-home test, which was nice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Glassmeyer makes you work for your grade. He splits the class into groups to work and hands out worksheets with instructions instead of actually teaching. Homework is assigned literally every class and is graded on accuracy, but tests are straight from the study guide. If you are bad at math and need it verbally explained to you do not take him
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Glassmeyer is a nice person. He really wants you to do well in his class, will let you make corrections to your tests to earn points back, which really helps. He gives homework after every class. Doesn't walk you through every problem of the classwork. Be prepared to ask a lot of questions. Gives you a lot of group work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: All of your assignments are completed in groups. There are only three tests in the semester, so study!! He works backwards by giving you worksheets on new material BEFORE discussing it as a class. It makes it hard to actually learn the material. However, he is very helpful when he does discuss the lessons.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Glassmeyer really cares about the development of his students. He doesn't teach the history of mathematics like a history course. He wants everyone to take away skills for teaching from the class. He gives very good feedback. The homeworks are easy, you just have to answer a few questions about the assigned reading, and there are a few projects

Teaches multiple courses, but it doesn't matter. Dr. Glassmeyer is an AWESOME professor to have! He is 100% approachable and really shows he cares and wants you to succeed. Students are encouraged to speak and class is not the usual boring lecture to make you fall asleep. I always look forward to his class time and don't even look at the clock!

Dr. G is my fave prof of all time. His teaching style is heavily student driven, which allows your to learn how to think like a teacher. Must be willing to present to the class, must feel comfortable being questioned by peers and prof on your reasoning. His class has made me a better teacher. He pushes you because he really wants you to do well. 3

Dr. David Glassmeyer is a great professor & a welcomed breath of fresh air. No longer suffer through  the tired old "sage on the stage" approach to math. He leads a very active and fun classroom, is engaging, and actually practices the pedagogy in his own methods that modern research proves to be highly effective. Too bad there is only 1 of him!!!

Lots of group thinking and personal presentations. Dr. G is slow at giving grades but definitely fair. He's always willing to help. Go to his office hours as soon as you have even the slightest bit of confusion on something. The class is challenging only if you don't have an open mind and if you don't utilize the help surrounding you..i.e. Dr. G!

I took Dave for Business Calc.  However, Dave did a great job and integrates the class and the work very well. He explains things well. Is always there to help. He truly wants you to be successful but you have to do your part also. I had a C in College Algebra. Came out of Dave's class with a well earned B-Sincerely one of the Three amigos Fall2013

Gives you every opportunity to do well. Gives extra credit on almost everything and will drop lowest grades in several different categories at the end of the semester. I am not a math person and have failed a couple of other math courses, but I went into the final with a 100 in this class. Gives a lot of homework, but it really does help you learn.

No a very good professor. I hated the way he taught the class, it was very backwards to me. He'd give us a class work sheet to work on, on material that we haven't learned. Then during the last 15 minutes of class, he'd teach us how to do the work that we've been guessing on for the whole. I wouldn't recommend him.

First calculus class ever and it is really giving me a run for my money. But he is willing to work with you to figure out how to understand the material. He'll make you work for the right answer though, nothing given in this class.

Calculus is HARD. I think that's why the other reviews are the way they are. However, for such a hard class, Mr. Glassmeyer is the best choice. You have to work to get an A, but where will you find a calculus class that just hands those out? I studied a lot, and asked him for extra help, and ended up with an A in the course. I recommend him highly.

I took this course after failing a previous math course. So it goes without saying, I felt uneasy going into a calculus course. As long as you do the readings (which are short), and keep up with assignments you will do well. Go to class for he provides great lectures that condense the chapters well, as well as in class activities which are graded.

He is not your traditional teacher, he grades really hard. Don't be surprised if you don't do well on a quiz, he has high expectations. I never felt overwhelmed in the class, just make sure to present in the class so you get your points.

Professor Glassmeyer is not a great teacher at all, and it doesn't help that calculus is a VERY difficult course. He is not helpful and doesn't keep up with grades well. I had a 78 in his class and he was missing grades for me and would not put them in. He lost my papers and blamed it on me. I could have made a B in that class but was given a C.
